hypothesis_content.title: High-Frequency Mean Reversion on 15-minute BTC Excess Volatility
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC's 15-minute price moves more than 1.5 standard deviations (based on 20-period rolling volatility) from its VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price) of the last 4 hours, it will revert 50% of the way back to that VWAP within the next 10 candles (150 minutes) with 65% accuracy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional momentum, making large deviations from volume-weighted averages unsustainable. High-frequency market makers and arbitrage bots quickly correct these dislocations.
entry_conditions: |BTC price - 4H VWAP| > 1.5 * (20-period rolling std dev on 15m)
Trade in direction of VWAP (short if price > VWAP + threshold, long if price < VWAP - threshold)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves another 0.5 standard deviations away from VWAP (opposite direction)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Success rate < 55% OR average win/loss ratio < 1.2 over 100+ simulated trades.
